title: Ticket #5528: Document docker universe volume mounts
description: The docker universe volume mount code is documented in ticket #5308 but never made it into the manual.
remarks:
2016-Jun-30 13:59:19 by wenger:
Greg, do you have any example config and submit files you could send me for this? (Oops -- put this in the wrong ticket first.)

2016-Sep-29 09:49:02 by gthain:
Here is an example configuration snippet. This defines two docker volumes, directories from the host (outer) filesystem which we'd like to make visible to the inner docker container, named TMP and DATA. TMP comes from /tmp on the host, and DATA from /home/data. We'll mount DATA read-only within the container.

In 8.5, we get the new knob DOCKER_VOLUME_DIR_TMP_MOUNT_IF for conditional mounting of volumes. 

DOCKER_VOLUMES = DATA TMP
DOCKER_VOLUME_DIR_DATA = /home/data:/home/data:ro
DOCKER_VOLUME_DIR_TMP = /tmp
DOCKER_VOLUME_DIR_TMP_MOUNT_IF = WantTmp =?= true
DOCKER_MOUNT_VOLUMES = GTHAIN, DATA

2016-Sep-29 09:50:35 by gthain:
Note that this has been in the 8.4 manual for a while.
